name: Post-Traumatic Abdominal Compartment Syndrome with Concurrent Necrotizing Pancreatitis
chief_complaint: My belly feels like it's going to explode and I can't breathe properly
treatment: aggressive fluid resuscitation with invasive hemodynamic monitoring
prognosis: Guarded with high mortality risk (40-60%); survivors often require prolonged ICU stay and multiple reoperations
description: A life-threatening condition where trauma-induced intra-abdominal hypertension progresses to multi-organ failure, complicated by enzymatic autodigestion from concurrent pancreatic necrosis. Presents with the triad of abdominal distension, respiratory compromise, and renal dysfunction.
multiple_choice: Post-Traumatic Abdominal Compartment Syndrome with Concurrent Necrotizing Pancreatitis
